FuncDef:
The if-match as-path-filter command sets a filtering rule that is based on the AS_Path filter.
The undo if-match as-path-filter command cancels the configuration. The if-match as-path-filter command sets a filtering rule that is based on the AS_Path filter. The undo if-match as-path-filter command cancels the configuration. By default, no filtering rule based on the AS_Path filter is set.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of the AS path filter.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 256.

Specifies the name of an AS_Path filter.
The value is a string of 1 to 51 case-sensitive characters. If spaces are used, the string must start and end with double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo: The AS_Path attribute is a proprietary attribute of BGP. The if-match as-path-filter command is applicable mainly to BGP routes. The ip as-path-filter command must be used to define an AS_Path filter so that the filtering rule based on this AS_Path filter can take effect. For example:
